Course.Title: INTEG BUSINESS STRATEGY
Course.Description: Capstone for business core, General management issues and decisions, quantitative and qualitative analysis of external and internal factors affecting firm performance. Use of case analyses and competitive business simulation for integration of functional and strategic decisions.

Sections.Comments: WENZHOU KEAN STUDENTS ONLY. Business seniors only

Course.Title: PRINCIPLES OF MARKETING
Course.Description: Course is an overview of the concepts, principles and activities that comprise contemporary marketing management. Specific topics include customer behavior, marketing environment analysis, segmentation, product planning, pricing, channels of distribution, and promotion. Special attention is focused on profitability analysis, international marketing, services marketing, and marketing ethics.

Sections.Comments: WENZHOU KEAN STUDENTS ONLY. BUSINESS STUDENTS ONLY Junior FIN, sophomore GBUS/SC first
Sections.Title: PRINCIPLES OF MARKETING

Course.Title: CONSUMER BEHAVIOR
Course.Description:
This course provides insight into the motivations, influences, and processes underlying consumer behavior. It involves a review and analysis of social and psychological theories, industry trends, and ethical issues as they relate to understanding consumer behavior and effective marketing strategies. Students learn to interpret, evaluate, and apply consumer behavior knowledge to consumer buying habits, pre-purchase decision processes, and post-purchase evaluation.  

Prerequisite(s): MKT 2500

Sections.CourseDescription:

Students learn to interpret, evaluate, and apply consumer behavior knowledge to consumer buying habits, pre-purchase decision processes, and post-purchase evaluation.  

Prerequisite(s): MKT 2500
MeetingsDisplay: Tuesday, Thursday 8:30 AM - 9:45 AM COLL BUSINESS&PUBLIC MGT A303 (Lecture)
Sections.Comments: WENZHOU KEAN STUDENTS ONLY. BUSINESS STUDENTS ONLY Sophomore MKT first
Sections.Title: CONSUMER BEHAVIOR

Course.Title: LOGISTICS & TRANSPORTATION
Course.Description: The course focuses on the study of logistics and transportation services in the marketing of goods and services.  Topics covered include customer service, distribution operations, contracts, order processing, carrier selection, transportation costing, and negotiation.  The role of information technology and the application of various techniques used in establishing and enhancing customer value as well as maintaining relative cost advantage are emphasized. Formerly MKT 4420.

Sections.CourseDescription: The course focuses on the study of logistics and transportation services in the marketing of goods and services. Sections.Comments: WENZHOU KEAN STUDENTS ONLY. junior GBUS/SC/MKT only

Course.Title: DATA MINING IN BUSINESS
Course.Description: Data mining involves developing and using techniques, such as prediction, classification and clustering to assist managers in making intelligent use of vast amounts of consumer data. In marketing these techniques are used for database marketing and customer relationship management. This course provides an overview of data mining concepts and techniques. Applications of data mining and class projects are a major component of the course.

Sections.CourseDescription: Data mining involves developing and using techniques, such as prediction, classification and clustering to assist managers in making intelligent use of vast amounts of consumer data. In marketing these techniques are used for database marketing and customer relationship management. This course provides an overview of data mining concepts and techniques. Applications of data mining and class projects are a major component of the course.
MeetingsDisplay: Tuesday, Thursday 5:30 PM - 6:45 PM COLL BUSINESS&PUBLIC MGT A102 (Lecture)
Sections.Comments: WENZHOU-KEAN STUDENTS ONLY BUSINESS STUDENTS ONLY As MKT/SC major elective, senior MKT/SC first
Sections.Title: DATA MINING IN BUSINESS

Course.Title: INTERNATIONAL MARKETING
Course.Description: This course is an in-depth study of marketing principles and strategies as they relate to the global marketplace. It explains the impact of cultural, financial, technological, governmental, legal, organizational, and demographic factors on the global marketing mix. Specific attention is placed on the development of analytical and planning sophistication to support international marketing strategies.

Sections.CourseDescription: This course is an in-depth study of marketing principles and strategies as they relate to the global marketplace. MeetingsDisplay: Wednesday, Friday 8:30 AM - 9:45 AM COLL BUSINESS&PUBLIC MGT A102 (Lecture)
Sections.Comments: WENZHOU-KEAN STUDENTS ONLY senior GBUS, junior MKT first
Sections.Title: INTERNATIONAL MARKETING

Course.Title: FORMAL LOGIC
Course.Description: The formal study of arguments, including deductive validity and soundness, logical entailment, translating statements and arguments in English into propositional logic and predicate logic, truth tables, and derivations.

Course.Description: How to use basic philosophical principles for evaluating arguments found in areas such as business, advertising, politics, morality and religion.  Introductory training in using computers to evaluate arguments.

Course.Title: THE PHILOSOPHY OF LAW
Course.Description: A critical discussion of the most prominent theories of the sources, nature, and function of the law, as well as a study of basic problems such as the logic of legal argumentation and the relation between law and morality.

Course.Title: THEORIES OF PUNISHMENT
Course.Description: A description and critical appraisal of various philosophical and legal justification for punishment. Special emphasis on philosophical pictures of human nature relative to punishment.

Course.Title: GENERAL PHYSICS I
Course.Description: Mechanics, wave motion, and sound. PHYS 2091/2092 is an algebra-trigonometry based sequence designed to give the student a general understanding of the laws and principles of physics. Students may not receive credit for both PHYS 2091 and PHYS 2095.
